page.title: 09Living in Crossmichael
page.content: There are about 400 residents. About half live in the Council Estate. The rest live in the new private houses or in the old style homes along the main road. There is a primary school with 2 teachers and 25 pupils. When the school opened in 1964 there were 94 pupils. There is a play group in the school twice a week. In 1984 the Community Council planted 4 trees at the school. There is a public park with swings for children, two shops, a village hall, a church, a marina, a pub - the Thistle Inn - and a small bowling hall. There is a day centre for mentally handicapped adults. Crossmichael drama group is quite well known in amateur competitions.
